intro: Montanoa subglabra, commonly known as the smooth montanoa, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually smooth and lance-shaped, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Montanoa subglabra is often found in open woodlands and scrublands, contributing to the biodiversity of its native regions.
